page.title: 06CLIMATE: NORTH WEST PENRITH
page.content: This area has good hot sun for 210 days of the year,the rain mostly falls between Spring and Winter.The rainfall is 1500mm a year.The temperature for the area can be as much as 25C,but the normal temperature is about 12C.In winters the snow often cuts the smaller farms off from the outside world for up to ten days & they have to be ready for this.The northern area gets a bad wind called the "helm" wind around November.This wind gets up to 125km/h and is like a hurricane. Snow can fall some 45 days of the year but,one year,in 1980,the"snow" fell mostly as rain.
